resistor: Resistor (R): A resistor opposes the flow of electric current and converts electrical energy into heat. Unit: Ohm (Ω). V–I Relation: V = IR.
inductor: Inductor (L): An inductor stores energy in the form of a magnetic field. Unit: Henry (H). V–I Relation: V = L (di/dt).
capacitor: Capacitor (C): A capacitor stores energy in the form of an electric field. Unit: Farad (F). V–I Relation: I = C (dV/dt).
ohms law: Ohm’s Law: Voltage across a conductor is directly proportional to current. V = IR.
kirchhoffs current law: KCL: The algebraic sum of currents at a node is zero.
kirchhoffs voltage law: KVL: The algebraic sum of voltages around any closed loop is zero.
